title: Improving Diffusion Models for ECG Imputation with an Augmented Template Prior. (arXiv:2310.15742v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Pulsative signals such as the electrocardiogram (ECG) are extensively collected as part of routine clinical care. However, noisy and poor-quality recordings, leading to missing values, are a major issue for signals collected using mobile health systems, decreasing the signal quality and affecting the automated downstream tasks. Recent studies have explored imputation of missing values for ECG with probabilistic time-series models. Nevertheless, in comparison with the deterministic models, their performance is still limited, as the variations across subjects and heart-beat relationships are not explicitly considered in the training objective.
